p: Following the MUPT, GS8 from 36.6 to 35.5 ka GICC05 and GI7 from 35.5 to 34.7 ka GICC05 are difficult to separate from each other in the speleothem records. The Black Sea record shows severe cooling during GS8 ( Fig. 2). The AC-δ 18O record suggests a significant fluctuation of the regional hydrologic condition during GS8 and GI7 in agreement with extended soil formation in the Danube Valley and the East Carpathians ( 19, 22). Higher moisture availability may have masked the temperature signal in AC-δ 13C. After GI7, a long-term cooling trend is superimposed on DO variability throughout Europe ( Fig. 2), in many places coincident with a long drying trend ( 20, 25).
